Technique: FORMED BY HAND; PAINTED; FAYENCE; WRITTEN WITH A REED PEN/REED WITH SPLIT NIB
Name: Shabti of Henuttawi
Description: This shabti in blue faience (of the "overseer" type , compare E.5426 A) is of quite average manufacture. It is in the name of Henuttawi, namesake of the famous queen of the 21st Dynasty. Several funerary statuettes of this person, which have been discovered in the SecondCachette of Deir el-Bahari, are preserved in the collections of european museums.
